intro: Heterochaenia rivalsii, commonly known as the Rivals' heterochaenia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
